issues.description: The problem statement requires ExcellenceLand.rides to be a private List<Ride> and asks for public getters for all attributes (so the getter should expose the rides as a List). In the solution, the field is declared as private List<Ride> but the getter returns java.util.Set<Ride> (getRides() returns a HashSet created from the list). This mismatches the attribute type declared in the specification and will confuse students about the expected getter signature and return type (and may cause tests that expect a List<Ride> getter to fail).
issues.suggested_fix: Make the getter consistent with the specified attribute type. Either (a) change the getter to return List<Ride> (e.g. public List<Ride> getRides() { return new ArrayList<>(rides); }) so it matches the private List<Ride> attribute and the problem statement, or (b) if a Set is intended, update the problem statement and the attribute type to use Set<Ride> so all artifacts agree. Option (a) is recommended to preserve the current problem description.
